alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 24 at 11:38AM EST until December 24 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire and Maine... Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Grafton and Belknap Counties. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Maine and New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Carroll, Oxford, and Cumberland Counties. Piscataquog River NEAR Goffstown affecting Hillsborough County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Parking lots along Front Street begin to flood. Town dock begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water enters the back side of buildings along Water Street. Front Street becomes completely submerged. The parking lot by town dock flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:20 AM EST Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 11.3 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
